contextId.information: The word "Jerusalem" refers to the people of Judah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here the men refer to their "hand" to emphasize that they plan to kill him themselves. AT: "we ourselves will kill you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: you will die by our hand

contextId.information: "in order that everyone can see that you are very great and keep your promises. " (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: for the sake of your name

contextId.information: Here the word "eyes" represents Yahweh who sees all that they do. AT: "I am watching everything they do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: my eye is on all their ways

contextId.information: "Day" represents the span of time for God's judgment to take place. AT: "in times of calamity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The eyes stand for the potter himself. AT: "good to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
The eyes of Yahweh refer to Yahweh himself. AT: "things that I consider to be evil" or "evil according to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This person is referred to by the part of his body associated with emotions. AT: "by his wicked desires" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: what his evil, stubborn heart desires

contextId.information: Here "nations" refers to the people of those nations. AT: "Then many people from various nations will pass by this city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Then many nations will pass by this city.

contextId.information: "they strengthen those who do evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "I will bless them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: I will set my eyes on them for good

contextId.information: AT: "they will turn to me with their whole being" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: they will turn to me with all their heart

contextId.information: AT: "lessen Yahweh's anger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Sword" represents warfare. AT: "I am going to punish them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: I am about to send sword, famine, and disease on them

contextId.information: "Name" refers to a person's authority and reputation. AT: "based on your own authority and reputation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The hand is a synecdoche for the person. AT: "through Jeremiah, who was a prophet." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: by the hand of Jeremiah the prophet

contextId.information: The eyes area synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "as he watched them do it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "Ishmael" represents the ten men with him. AT: "Then Ishmael and the ten men with him killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here King Baasha represents his army. AT: "against Baasha, king of Israel, and his army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "Ishmael" represents all of his men. AT: "whom Ishmael and his men had captured" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"He" refers to Ishmael who represents the eight men with him. AT: "They went to the people of Ammon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: He went to the people of Ammon

contextId.information: The men are used to refer to all the people because they are the leaders in their families. AT: "anyone who sets out" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_gendernotations]])
contextId.quote: all the men who set out

contextId.information: Here "he" refers to Nebuchadnezzar who represents his whole army. AT: "Nebuchadnezzar's army will come" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here Nebuchadnezzar represents his army. AT: "Nebuchadnezzar's army will ... They will" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "streets" represent the public places in Jerusalem. AT: "in the public places of Jerusalem" or "in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Here "mouths" and "hands" represent the whole person. AT: "have done what you promised to do when you said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: have said with your mouths and carried out with your hands what you said

contextId.information: The word "heart" refers to the deep emotions felt by Jeremiah. AT: "I am deeply sad for". (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
a safe place within the city of Heshbon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
AT: "I will establish my rule over" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This refers to the soldiers who use bows and arrows to fight. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
"Sword" represents those who use them. AT: "enemy soldiers with swords are coming against the Chaldeans" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: A sword is against the Chaldeans

contextId.information: "Waters" represent all the sources of water and other necessities for life, especially the river that went through the city. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
This phrase refers to the Babylonian people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
